<s>[INST] What actions can subject an employee in this unit to disciplinary action? [/INST],  Actions such as strike, slowdown, or any other concerted activity that diminishes services provided by an employee in this unit, or the failure to perform lawfully required work can subject the employee to disciplinary action up to and including discharge. </s>

<s>[INST] What consequences can the Association face if it violates the specified subsection and fails to take corrective action? [/INST],  If the Association, its officers, or its authorized representatives violate the specified subsection and fail to take prompt affirmative action to correct and terminate the conduct, they may face suspension or revocation of recognition, suspension or cancellation of payroll deductions, prohibition or restriction on the use of City facilities, and prohibition or restriction on access to work or duty stations of employees in the representation unit. </s>

<s>[INST] What should be included in the written notice for alleged conduct violation? [/INST],  The written notice should identify the alleged conduct in violation of Subsection 4.3.2 of the Agreement. </s>
<s>[INST] Who signed the MOU? [/INST],  The MOU was signed between the City of San Jose and one of the bargaining units available in the City. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the language of Subsection 4.3.2? [/INST],  The language of Subsection 4.3.2 is provided to the Association member(s) in the MOU. </s>
<s>[INST] What conduct does the Association not authorize violating Subsection 4.3.2? [/INST],  The Association does not authorize any conduct violating Subsection 4.3.2. </s>
<s>[INST] What must the Association member(s) do in relation to Subsection 4.3.2? [/INST],  The Association member(s) must comply with Subsection 4.3.2 and immediately cease any violation of it. </s>

<s>[INST] How can the Association provide written notice in accordance with this provision? [/INST],  The Association can provide written notice by sending an e-mail to the known e-mail address of the Association member(s) engaging in the alleged conduct, as provided by the City to the Association. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the non-discrimination policy of the parties involved? [/INST],  The parties agree not to discriminate against any employee based on race, religion, color, creed, age, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, actual or perceived gender identity, and political affiliation. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the non-discrimination policy regarding union membership and authorized activity? [/INST],  The parties agree not to discriminate against any employee based on membership or lack of membership in the Union, or because of any authorized activity on behalf of the Association. </s>

<s>[INST] According to the MOU, what is the purpose of the Association? [/INST],  The purpose of the Association is to meet and confer on matters within the scope of representation for employees assigned to the classifications listed in Exhibit A. </s>
<s>[INST] Which classifications are considered an appropriate unit according to the MOU? [/INST],  The classifications listed in Exhibit A are considered an appropriate unit. </s>
<s>[INST] Are Deputy City Attorneys or Senior Deputy City Attorneys represented by the Association? [/INST],  No, Deputy City Attorneys or Senior Deputy City Attorneys are unrepresented. </s>

<s>[INST] Under what circumstances can an employee represented by the Association perform legal services on labor relations and employment matters? [/INST],  An employee represented by the Association can perform legal services on labor relations and employment matters if the City Attorney designates them and they become an unrepresented employee in the Executive Management and Professional Employees unit. </s>

<s>[INST] Who has the discretion to designate the Deputy City Attorney or Senior Deputy City Attorney? [/INST],  The City Attorney has the discretion to designate the Deputy City Attorney or Senior Deputy City Attorney with the express prior written consent of the selected employee. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens to the designated employee upon receipt of written notification to the Association? [/INST],  The designated employee becomes exempt and will be unrepresented, subject to the benefits and compensation for Unit 99. The job specification for the position will not change. </s>

<s>[INST] Can the City Attorney change the employee designated for the exempt position? [/INST],  Yes, the City Attorney may change the employee designated for the exempt position at any time, following the notice and consent provisions mentioned above. The newly designated employee will be transferred to Unit 99, while the employee who no longer performs such legal services for the City will be represented by the Association and subject to the benefits and compensation for ALP. </s>

<s>[INST] What rights does the City retain in terms of management? [/INST],  The City retains all rights, powers, and authority granted to it pursuant to any law or the City Charter. This includes the right to direct the workforce, increase, decrease, or re-assign the workforce, hire, promote, demote, discharge or discipline for cause, transfer or reclassify employees, and provide merit-based compensation. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the management rights of the City of San Jose? [/INST],  The City of San Jose has the right to make decisions regarding employee wages, hours, and other terms and conditions of employment. They also have the authority to assign employees special work requirements and determine the necessity, merits, mission, and organization of any service or activity of the City or any City Department, Agency, or Unit. The City's failure to exercise a management right does not prevent them from exercising it in the future. </s>

<s>[INST] Who is the principal authorized agent of the City for administering the terms and provisions of the various ordinances, resolutions, rules, and regulations adopted pursuant to the Agreement? [/INST],  The principal authorized agent of the City for administering the terms and provisions of the various ordinances, resolutions, rules, and regulations adopted pursuant to the Agreement is the Municipal Employee Relations Officer, or his/her duly authorized representative, unless a particular City representative is otherwise designated. </s>

<s>[INST] What information and lists will be treated in a confidential manner according to the MOU? [/INST],  The Association agrees that such information and lists will be treated in a confidential manner. </s>

<s>[INST] When will the deductions and the list be remitted to the Association? [/INST],  The deductions and the list will be remitted to the Association not later than twenty-one (21) calendar days following the pay period in which the deductions were made. </s>

<s>[INST] What rights do employees in a classification represented by the Association have? [/INST],  Employees in a classification represented by the Association have the right to join and/or participate, or alternatively, the equal right to refuse to join and/or participate, in the Association or its lawful activities. Neither party shall discriminate against an employee in the exercise of these alternative rights. </s>

<s>[INST] Is membership in the Association compulsory for employees? [/INST],  No, membership in the Association is not compulsory. Employees must voluntarily join the Association as provided under State law and this section. </s>

<s>[INST] What can the City and the Association agree upon regarding dues deductions from represented employees? [/INST],  The City and the Association may agree upon a process for the collection and remittance of voluntary dues deductions from represented employees that are in addition to those specified in Article 8. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Association's responsibility regarding indemnification, defense, and hold harmless? [/INST],  The Association shall indemnify, defend, and hold the City harmless against any and all suits, claims, demands, and any other liabilities that may arise out of or by reason of any action that shall be taken or not taken by the City in connection with the City's interpretation, application, administration, or enforcement of any section in this Agreement pertaining to dues deductions. The existence or extent of any indemnification obligation under this Section shall be subject to the City's grievance procedure or, upon adoption of an agreed-upon grievance procedure in this Agreement, in accordance with such agreement's grievance procedure, if any. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the grievance procedure mentioned in the MOU? [/INST],  The grievance procedure, if any, is not specified in the provided content. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens if the City fails to make the authorized deduction for association dues? [/INST],  If the City fails to make the authorized deduction for association dues, they are not responsible for correcting the omission or error retroactively. The Association is required to refund any erroneously withheld dues to the employee. If the Association fails to refund the dues within a reasonable period of time, the City will make the refund and deduct the amount from the Association's payment. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the one-time lump sum payment for full-time employees in ALP positions? [/INST],  Full-time employees in ALP positions who were employed on May 11, 2021, and still employed on June 27, 2021, will receive a $1,000 one-time, non-pensionable lump sum payment in recognition of work performed during the COVID-19 pandemic. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the one-time lump sum payment for part-time ALP represented employees? [/INST],  The content does not provide information about the specific amount or details of the one-time lump sum payment for part-time ALP represented employees. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the benefit level for employees with 30.00 - 34.00 hours? [/INST],  The benefit level for employees with 30.00 - 34.00 hours is $750. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the benefit level for employees with 25.00 - 29.00 hours? [/INST],  The benefit level for employees with 25.00 - 29.00 hours is $625. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the percentage increase in salary ranges for employees holding positions in classifications assigned to ALP in Fiscal Year 2023-2024? [/INST],  The salary ranges for employees holding positions in classifications assigned to ALP will be increased by approximately 3% in Fiscal Year 2023-2024. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the effective date of the salary range increase for employees holding positions in classifications assigned to ALP in Fiscal Year 2023-2024? [/INST],  The first full pay period of Fiscal Year 2023-2024 is the effective date for the salary range increase for employees holding positions in classifications assigned to ALP. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the monthly Technology Stipend amount for eligible employees starting from July 25, 2021? [/INST],  Eligible employees will receive a monthly Technology Stipend in the amount of $80 starting from July 25, 2021. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens to the Technology Stipend if an employee leaves the position in which they are receiving it? [/INST],  If an employee leaves the position in which they are receiving the Technology Stipend, they will cease to receive it. This occurs whenever an employee is transferred, promoted, reassigned, or otherwise leaves the specific position in which they were authorized to receive the Technology Stipend. </s>

<s>[INST] Who has the sole discretion in providing performance reviews and merit increases, including bonuses, in accordance with the City's Management Performance Program? [/INST],  The City Attorney has the sole discretion in providing performance reviews and merit increases, including bonuses, in accordance with the City's Management Performance Program. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Performance Program mentioned in the MOU? [/INST],  The Performance Program refers to the guidelines and policies outlined in Section 3.3.2 of the City Policy Manual as of the Effective Date. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The purpose of the MOU is to establish the terms and conditions of employment for the bargaining unit within the City of San Jose. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the Bilingual Pay in the MOU? [/INST],  The purpose of the Bilingual Pay in the MOU is to provide additional compensation to employees who are required to use a non-English language on a regular basis. They can receive a bi-weekly payment of $29 for oral only bilingual or $40 per pay period for oral/written translation, provided they are certified as bilingual by the Human Resources Department. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the reimbursement amount for professional development costs for full-time Association employees? [/INST],  The reimbursement amount for professional development costs for full-time Association employees is up to at least $1,300 per fiscal year. Additionally, the amount set forth for professional materials shall increase to $600 per fiscal year. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the maximum reimbursement for professional materials for employees working 35-39.9 hours per week? [/INST],  $1,300.00 </s>
<s>[INST] Are temporary employees eligible for the professional materials benefit? [/INST],  No, temporary employees are not eligible for this benefit. </s>

<s>[INST] What professional memberships does the City pay for active attorneys in a classification requiring membership in good standing with the California State Bar? [/INST],  The City pays for membership dues for the California State Bar Association and one section. </s>

<s>[INST] Does the City pay for membership dues for the Santa Clara County Bar Association for active attorneys in a classification requiring membership in good standing with the California State Bar? [/INST],  Yes, the City pays for membership dues for the Santa Clara County Bar Association, subject to the availability of funds in the budget of the Office of the City Attorney as determined by the City Attorney. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the eligibility for reimbursement of membership fees or dues for employees represented by the Association? [/INST],  Employees represented by the Association, who are not covered by Sections 13.1 and 13.2, are eligible for reimbursement of membership fees or dues paid for the maintenance of a license required to perform their job and for membership in one additional job-related professional association. However, active attorneys in a classification requiring membership in good standing with the California State Bar are not eligible for reimbursement under this section. </s>

<s>[INST] What retirement system covers employees represented by the Association? [/INST],  Employees represented by the Association are covered by the Federated City Employees’2019 Retirement System. Retirement benefits are provided in accordance with the provisions of the plan, City Charter, and/or Municipal Code. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the status of the retiree healthcare benefit? [/INST],  The retiree healthcare benefit is subject to the reopener in Subsection 4.1.3 of this Agreement. The City and Association agree that they must address a number of issues regarding the retiree healthcare benefit, and the parties intend to continue negotiating and working on it. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the initial unfunded retiree health care liability for the Plan? [/INST],  The initial unfunded retiree health care liability for the Plan shall be fully amortized over a thirty year period and paid by June 30, 2039 (closed amortization). </s>

<s>[INST] How will changes in the unfunded retiree healthcare liability be amortized? [/INST],  Amortization of changes in the unfunded retiree healthcare liability other than the initial retiree healthcare liability (e.g. gains, losses, changes in actuarial assumptions, etc.) shall be determined by the Plan's actuary. </s>

<s>[INST] Who will contribute to funding the ARC and in what ratio? [/INST],  The City and Plan members (active employees) shall contribute to funding the ARC in the ratio currently provided under Section 3.28.385 of the San Jose Municipal Code. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the ratio of contributions for medical benefits between the City of San Jose and members? [/INST],  The ratio of contributions for medical benefits between the City of San Jose and members is one-to-one. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the ratio of contributions for retiree dental benefits between the City of San Jose and members? [/INST],  The ratio of contributions for retiree dental benefits between the City of San Jose and members is eight-to-three. </s>

<s>[INST] What actuarial cost method and discount rate does the Plan use when determining contribution rates? [/INST],  The Plan uses the Entry Age Normal (EAN) actuarial cost method and a discount rate consistent with the pre-funding policy for the Plan. </s>

<s>[INST] Will the Municipal Code and/or applicable plan documents be amended according to the agreement? [/INST],  Yes, the Municipal Code and/or applicable plan documents will be amended according to the agreement, and the Association will support such amendments. </s>

<s>[INST] When will the phase-in to the Annual Required Contribution (ARC) be effective? [/INST],  The phase-in to the Annual Required Contribution (ARC) will be effective on the first pay period of the City's fiscal year in each succeeding year, starting from the first increment that was effective on June 28, 2009. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the contribution rate for retiree healthcare as of June 20, 2015? [/INST],  The contribution rate for retiree healthcare as of June 20, 2015 will remain in effect until December 19, 2015. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the contribution rate based upon the full Annual Required Contribution? [/INST],  The contribution rate is based upon the full Annual Required Contribution. </s>
<s>[INST] When did the contributions begin? [/INST],  The contributions began on December 20, 2015. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the qualified 115 trust? [/INST],  The purpose of the qualified 115 trust is to receive employee contributions and avoid reaching IRS limits on the existing medical benefits account. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens if the contributions are treated as post-tax by the IRS? [/INST],  If the contributions are treated as post-tax by the IRS, the City agrees to indemnify any employee for any IRS liability arising from the contributions that were taken as pre-tax prior to the IRS determination. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the objective of the Trust created pursuant to this Agreement? [/INST],  The objective of the Trust created pursuant to this Agreement is to become the sole funding vehicle for Federated retiree health care benefits, subject to any legal considerations. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the effective date for employees hired into full-time benefited positions? [/INST],  The effective date for employees hired into full-time benefited positions is September 29, 2013. </s>

<s>[INST] Who will not participate in or be eligible for the defined benefit retiree healthcare program? [/INST],  Employees hired into full-time benefited positions on or after September 29, 2013 will not participate in or be eligible for the defined benefit retiree healthcare program. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The MOU is valid from July 1, 2021, to June 30, 2024. </s>

<s>[INST] What are some of the rights or assertions related to the retiree healthcare benefit mentioned in the MOU? [/INST],  Some of the rights or assertions related to the retiree healthcare benefit mentioned in the MOU include vested rights of employees, interpretation of San Jose Municipal Code provisions, the retiree healthcare benefit funding plan, member contribution rates, deductions made by the City, and any other issue related to the retiree healthcare benefit. </s>

<s>[INST] When was the 'Kaiser 1500' healthcare plan imposed by the City for bargaining unit employees? [/INST],  The 'Kaiser 1500' healthcare plan was unilaterally imposed by the City on June 12, 2012. </s>
<s>[INST] What does Article 16 of the Agreement refer to? [/INST],  Article 16 of the Agreement refers to the Deferred Compensation Plan. </s>

<s>[INST] What percentage of the cost of the lowest priced Non-Deductible HMO plan does the City pay for the employee? [/INST],  The City pays eighty-five percent (85%) of the cost of the lowest priced Non-Deductible HMO plan for the tier of the rate structure selected by the employee. </s>

<s>[INST] Can an employee be simultaneously covered by City-provided medical benefits and as a dependent of another City employee or retiree? [/INST],  No, an employee may not be simultaneously covered by City-provided medical benefits as a City employee and as a dependent of another City employee or retiree. </s>

<s>[INST] What types of dental insurance plans are available for eligible employees and their dependents? [/INST],  The City provides two available dental insurance plans: an indemnity plan and a dental health maintenance organization plan. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the rate structure for available health plans? [/INST],  The rate structure for available health plans is a 4-tier structure, including Employee, Employee plus spouse/domestic partner, Employee plus Child(ren), and Family. </s>

<s>[INST] What percentage of the lowest priced plan does the City pay for full-time employees? [/INST],  For full-time employees, the City pays 100% of the lowest priced plan for the employee or the employee and dependent coverage. </s>

<s>[INST] Can an employee be simultaneously covered by City-provided dental benefits and as a dependent of another City employee or retiree? [/INST],  No, an employee may not be simultaneously covered by City-provided dental benefits as a City employee and as a dependent of another City employee or retiree. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance program? [/INST],  The purpose of the payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance program is to allow employees who have alternative health and/or dental insurance coverage to drop the City's insurance and receive a payment in lieu. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the rate structure for payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance? [/INST],  The rate structure for payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance is a 4-tier structure, including Employee, Employee plus Spouse/Domestic Partner, Employee plus Child(ren), and Family. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the City's contribution for part-time employees who work less than 20 hours? [/INST],  None </s>
<s>[INST] What is the City's contribution for part-time employees who work 30-39 hours? [/INST],  75% </s>
<s>[INST] What is the City's contribution for part-time employees who work 25-29 hours? [/INST],  62.5% </s>
<s>[INST] What is the City's contribution for part-time employees who work 20-24 hours? [/INST],  50% </s>
<s>[INST] What is the City's contribution for part-time employees who work less than 20 hours? [/INST],  None </s>
<s>[INST] What is the effective date of the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The MOU is effective from July 1, 2021, to June 30, 2024. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the payment in-lieu amount for health insurance for an employee with no dependents? [/INST],  The payment in-lieu amount for health insurance for an employee with no dependents is $89.09 per pay period. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the deadline for notifying the City if alternative health coverage is lost? [/INST],  The employee must notify the City immediately and provide written verification of lost coverage within 30 days of the loss of coverage. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the City's responsibility if alternative dental coverage is lost prior to the annual open enrollment period? [/INST],  The City must receive the required enrollment form and written verification of lost coverage within 30 days of the loss of coverage. The employee must also pay any unpaid premiums and refund any excess in-lieu payments received to be restored to a City dental insurance plan of their choice. </s>
<s>[INST] What does the City pay for employee life insurance coverage? [/INST],  The City pays the full premium for employee coverage equal to two times the employee's annual salary. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the maximum annual salary available for employees? [/INST],  The maximum annual salary available for employees is $750,000. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the range of dependent coverage available for spouse and/or dependent children? [/INST],  The range of dependent coverage available for spouse and/or dependent children is $2,000 to $10,000. </s>
<s>[INST] What benefits are available for part-time and temporary employees? [/INST],  Part-time and temporary employees are not eligible for benefits. </s>

<s>[INST] What flexible spending accounts are offered to Association members? [/INST],  Association members have the option to participate in Dependent Care Assistance and Medical Reimbursement Programs. </s>

<s>[INST] What optional benefits are available for employees and their family members? [/INST],  The City offers vision insurance, personal accident insurance, and long-term care insurance as optional benefits for employees, their spouses, domestic partners, and children at the employee's expense. </s>

<s>[INST] How much does the City contribute towards vision care benefits for eligible full-time employees? [/INST],  The City contributes up to $16.00 per month ($8.00 for 24 bi-weekly pay periods) or the cost of the premium, whichever is less, for coverage under a vision plan sponsored by the City. The employee is responsible for paying the difference between the City's contribution and the total premium of the vision care plan selected. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the structure of the premium adjustments when the 4-tier structure is in effect? [/INST],  The premiums will be adjusted effective the first pay period of that payroll calendar year. </s>

<s>[INST] What options does the City offer employees for long-term disability insurance? [/INST],  The City offers employees a choice of two long-term disability plans, one with a 30-day waiting period and another with a 60-day waiting period. </s>
<s>[INST] Are temporary employees eligible to purchase long-term disability insurance? [/INST],  No, temporary employees are not eligible to purchase long-term disability insurance. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the effective date of the ALP MOA? [/INST],  The effective date of the ALP MOA is July 1, 2021. </s>
<s>[INST] Who is eligible for the Employee Assistance Program? [/INST],  Part-time and temporary employees are not eligible for the Employee Assistance Program. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the Substance Abuse Policy prohibit? [/INST],  The Substance Abuse Policy prohibits employees from reporting to work under the influence of alcohol or drugs, exhibiting symptoms of alcohol or drug use, using, possessing, selling or providing drugs or alcohol while on duty, and employees shall not have the ability to work or be on paid standby when impaired as a result of the use of alcohol or drugs. </s>

<s>[INST] What should employees do if they are taking medication or drugs that could create an unsafe situation? [/INST],  Employees are required to notify their supervisor when any medication or drug they are taking could create an unsafe and dangerous situation. </s>

<s>[INST] What options and benefits does the City offer to Association members in accordance with the Substance Abuse Policy? [/INST],  The City offers self-referral and rehabilitation/treatment options and benefits to Association members in accordance with the Substance Abuse Policy, as set forth in Section 1.4.2 of the City Policy Manual in effect on the Effective Date. </s>
<s>[INST] How many paid holidays do full-time employees receive each calendar year? [/INST],  Full-time employees receive 14 paid holidays each calendar year. </s>

<s>[INST] How are part-time employees reimbursed for holidays? [/INST],  Part-time employees are reimbursed for holidays based on their scheduled hours. For 30-39 hours, they receive 75% reimbursement. For 25-29 hours, they receive 62.5% reimbursement. For 20-24 hours, they receive 50% reimbursement. Part-time employees scheduled for less than 20 hours do not receive any reimbursement. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the annual vacation accrual rate for employees with 1-5 years of service? [/INST],  The annual vacation accrual rate for employees with 1-5 years of service is 120 hours. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the maximum accrued vacation for employees with 15+ years of service? [/INST],  The maximum accrued vacation for employees with 15+ years of service is 400 hours. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the maximum number of vacation hours that employees can sell back in a calendar year? [/INST],  Employees can sell back up to a maximum of sixty (60) hours of vacation hours in a calendar year. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens if an employee does not submit an irrevocable election form to Payroll by the end of November? [/INST],  If an employee does not submit an irrevocable election form to Payroll by the end of November, they will not be eligible to sell back any vacation hours during the next calendar year. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The MOU is valid from July 1, 2021, to June 30, 2024. </s>
<s>[INST] Can employees use vacation hours for sell back purposes? [/INST],  No, vacation hours elected for sell back can only be used for sell back purposes and not for vacation time off. </s>

<s>[INST] How many hours of executive leave do employees receive per payroll calendar year? [/INST],  Employees receive forty (40) hours of executive leave per payroll calendar year with supervisor approval. </s>
<s>[INST] Can unused executive leave carry over to the following year? [/INST],  No, unused executive leave does not accrue or carry over to the following year. </s>

<s>[INST] How is the proration of executive leave determined for employees hired or promoted into eligible positions? [/INST],  The proration of executive leave is dependent upon the hire date and is effective from the first pay period of payroll calendar year 2022. </s>

<s>[INST] What is executive leave and how is it administered in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  Executive leave is a non-accrued benefit in the City of San Jose and unused leave does not carry over from year to year. The City Attorney administers executive leave in accordance with the City's Executive Leave and Absence policy, as outlined in Section 4.2.4 of the City Policy Manual. Work schedule flexibility and the ability to avoid tracking or charging absences less than four hours to an employee's paid leave balance are subject to supervisory approval. </s>

<s>[INST] How is reimbursement/contribution for part-time employees calculated for executive leave? [/INST],  Reimbursement/contribution for part-time employees for executive leave is prorated based on the hours scheduled. Employees scheduled for 30-39 hours receive 75% reimbursement/contribution, those scheduled for 25-29 hours receive 62.5%, those scheduled for 20-24 hours receive 50%, and those scheduled for less than 20 hours receive none. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the entitlement of sick leave for full-time employees in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  Each full-time employee in the City of San Jose is entitled to sick leave with pay. The specific details of the entitlement are not provided in the given content. </s>

<s>[INST] How is sick leave accrued in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  Sick leave in the City of San Jose accrues in an amount equal to the number of hours worked, excluding overtime, multiplied by a factor of 0.04616. Paid leave for holidays, vacation, disability, or other paid leave is considered as time worked for the purpose of sick leave accrual. </s>

<s>[INST] Under what circumstances can accrued sick leave be utilized? [/INST],  Accrued sick leave can be utilized in the City of San Jose if the employee is required to be absent from work due to non-job related illness or injury, including absences related to pregnancy or childbirth for female employees. It can also be used for routine medical or dental appointments of the employee or certain individuals who need assistance, such as a child/stepchild for which the employee is legally responsible, or the employee's mother/stepmother, father/stepfather, spouse, or Domestic Partner. Additionally, it can be used for the care related to the illness or injury of a child/stepchild for which the employee is legally responsible, mother/stepmother, father/stepfather, spouse, or Domestic Partner. Up to forty-eight (48) hours of accrued sick leave per calendar year may be utilized for the care related to the illness or injury of a family member. </s>
<s>[INST] Who are considered as family members according to the MOU? [/INST],  Employee's grandparent, grandchild, brother, sister, father-in-law, or mother-in-law. </s>
<s>[INST] What should be the value of the chat_history key? [/INST],  [] </s>
<s>[INST] What should be the value of the ideal key? [/INST],  The answer to the question being generated. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the format of the JSON Lines Data Points? [/INST],  A list of JSON Objects. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the maximum number of working days for which accrued sick leave can be granted in circumstances involving an alleged job-related illness or injury without medical verification? [/INST],  Three (3) working days. </s>
<s>[INST] In accordance with which program can accrued sick leave be used? [/INST],  The Catastrophic Illness Time Donation Program as set forth in Section 4.2.10 of the City Policy Manual. </s>

<s>[INST] Under what circumstances is paid sick leave not allowed? [/INST],  Paid sick leave is not allowed for any absence from work occasioned by intoxication or use of narcotics not prescribed by a licensed physician. </s>

<s>[INST] Can an employee enrolled and participating in a substance abuse treatment program use sick leave for absences resulting from participation in such program? [/INST],  Yes, if approved by the City and appropriate verification may be required. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the requirement for an employee to be entitled to or granted sick leave? [/INST],  The employee or someone on their behalf must notify their immediate superior or the City Attorney of their intent to take sick leave due to a personal or family illness prior to the commencement of the sick leave, where such notice is possible. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the requirement for waiving the notice of absence for an employee? [/INST],  The City Attorney may waive the requirement of such notice upon presentation of a reasonable excuse by the employee. </s>

<s>[INST] What substantiation may be required for an absence for which sick leave payment is requested? [/INST],  An employee may be required to furnish substantiation for any absence for which sick leave payment is requested. </s>

<s>[INST] Who is entitled to paid sick leave in the City? [/INST],  Any eligible part-time employee shall be entitled to paid sick leave only for those days and number of hours the employee is in fact regularly assigned to work or would have been required to work. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the sick leave payout rate for members of the Federated City Employees' Retirement System with at least fifteen years of service? [/INST],  Members of the Federated City Employees' Retirement System hired on or before September 29, 2012, who retire with at least fifteen years of service are eligible to receive, upon retirement, payout for a portion of their unused earned sick leave at the rate of: 0-399 hours - 50% of final hourly rate, 400-799 hours - 60% of final hourly rate, 800-1,200 hours - 75% of final hourly rate. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens to an employee's sick leave balance and hourly rate for the purpose of sick leave payout? [/INST],  Effective June 22, 2013, for the purposes of sick leave payout, an employee's sick leave balance and hourly rate shall be frozen. This means that an employee will receive no more in sick leave payout after having met the requirements contained herein than they would have. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the sick leave payout after meeting the requirements contained in the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The sick leave payout after meeting the requirements contained in the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit is higher than what they would have been entitled to on June 22, 2013. Any sick leave usage after June 22, 2013, will come first. </s>
<s>[INST] When will the sick leave usage come into effect? [/INST],  The sick leave usage will come into effect after June 22, 2013. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the sick leave balance accrual date? [/INST],  The sick leave balance accrual date is June 22, 2013. </s>
<s>[INST] Can sick leave accrued after June 22, 2013 be used for sick leave payout purposes? [/INST],  No, sick leave accrued after June 22, 2013 cannot be used for sick leave payout purposes. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the process for requesting a leave of absence without pay in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  All requests for leaves of absence without pay in the City of San Jose must be made in writing. The City Attorney, or his/her designated representative, may grant an employee a leave of absence without pay for good and sufficient reason, not to exceed twelve (12) months. Such leaves may be extended, upon written request of the employee, for an additional six (6) months, subject to approval of the City Attorney, or his/her designated representative. Written requests for an extension of a leave should be submitted prior to the expiration of the leave. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the maximum duration of a leave of absence without pay in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  The maximum duration of a leave of absence without pay in the City of San Jose is twelve (12) months. However, such leaves may be extended for an additional six (6) months upon written request of the employee, subject to approval of the City Attorney, or his/her designated representative. Written requests for an extension of a leave should be submitted prior to the expiration of the leave. </s>

<s>[INST] Who shall administer leaves of absences and who has the right to leaves of absence in accordance with the City's Leave of Absence policy? [/INST],  The City Attorney shall administer leaves of absences and Association members have the right to leaves of absence in accordance with the City's Leave of Absence policy, as set forth in Section 4.2.1 of the City Policy Manual. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the bereavement leave policy for employees? [/INST],  Each full-time or benefited part-time employee shall be granted bereavement leave with full pay for up to forty (40) hours to attend to the customary obligations arising from the death of certain relatives, including parents, grandparents, spouses, children, siblings, and others as specified in Section 35.1 of the MOU. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the City's policy on bereavement leave? [/INST],  The City's policy on bereavement leave is administered by the City Attorney and is in accordance with the City's Bereavement Leave policy, as set forth in Section 4.2.5 of the City Policy Manual in effect on the Effective Date. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the City's policy on time donation programs? [/INST],  The City's policy on time donation programs allows Association employees to make time donations and is in accordance with the City's Time Donation Programs policy, as set forth in Section 4.2.10 of the City Policy Manual in effect on the Effective Date. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the City's policy on jury duty? [/INST],  The City's policy on jury duty states that full-time employees, or part-time employees eligible for benefits, who are required to take time off to serve as a juror in any Court of this State or of the United States of America, shall receive their regular base compensation less all jury fees received, excluding mileage. Employees receiving a notice to report for jury service must immediately notify their immediate supervisor. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the duration of the ALP MOA between City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The ALP MOA between City of San Jose and the bargaining unit is from July 1, 2021, to June 30, 2024. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of Article 38 in the MOU? [/INST],  The purpose of Article 38 in the MOU is to outline the provisions for witness leave for full-time employees of the City who are required to appear as a witness in any case or proceeding in any Court of this State or of the United States of America. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the reimbursement rate for the City of San Jose? [/INST],  The reimbursement rate for the City of San Jose is whatever reimbursement rate is applicable Citywide on the date reimbursement is requested. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the process for contracting out work currently performed by bargaining unit members? [/INST],  The City agrees to meet and confer with the Association prior to contracting out work currently performed by bargaining unit members when such contracting out would result in a material reduction of work done by Association members or have a significant adverse impact on bargaining unit work. Position reductions that result in lay-off of employees in the bargaining unit are considered a significant impact on bargaining unit work. </s>

<s>[INST] What guidelines should ALP and the City Attorney follow for telecommuting? [/INST],  ALP and the City Attorney should follow the process and guidelines provided in City Policy Manual, Section 4.2.14, Flexible Workplace Policy. The City will provide advance notice of any changes to the Flexible Workplace Policy that are subject to the meet and confer process. </s>

<s>[INST] Who is eligible to participate in the Employee Commute Benefit Program? [/INST],  Full-time and part-time employees who worked an average of twenty (20) or more hours per week within the previous calendar month are eligible to participate in the Employee Commute Benefit Program. Seasonal workers and Airport employees are not eligible to participate in the Employee Commute Benefit Program; the Airport provides its own separate program. </s>
<s>[INST] What program does the City of San Jose participate in? [/INST],  The City of San Jose participates in the Employee Commute Benefit Program. </s>
<s>[INST] What program does the Airport provide? [/INST],  The Airport provides its own separate employee commute program. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Employee Commute Benefit Program? [/INST],  The Employee Commute Benefit Program is a program available to eligible employees in the City of San Jose. It allows employees to participate in an Employee Commute Benefit Program through the Santa Clara Valley Transit Authority (VTA). This program allows eligible employees to use pre-tax dollars to pay for transit services beyond those provided by VTA, such as Caltrain, the Hwy 17 Express Bus, and BART. The administrative fees of the Pre-Tax Payroll Deduction Program are paid for by the City. </s>
<s>[INST] Who pays for the administrative fees of the Pre-Tax Payroll Deduction Program? [/INST],  The City of San Jose pays for the administrative fees of the Pre-Tax Payroll Deduction Program. </s>
