<s>[INST] What is the annual rate for Park Ranger, Senior? [/INST],  $76,710.40 - $93,496.00 </s>
<s>[INST] What is the estimated POPRA Pay Plan for Park Ranger? [/INST],  $34.53 - $42.09 </s>
<s>[INST] What is the estimated POPRA Pay Plan for Park Ranger, Senior? [/INST],  $37.99 - $46.30 </s>
<s>[INST] What is the additional compensation increase for the listed classifications? [/INST],  5% ongoing non-pensionable compensation increase </s>

<s>[INST] Where can I find additional information about the bargaining unit's Memorandum of Agreement? [/INST],  Please see the bargaining unit's Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) or the employee unit's Compensation Summary. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the MOU between the City of San Jose and the San José Police Officers’ Association? [/INST],  The duration of the MOU is from July 1, 2022, to June 30, 2025. </s>
<s>[INST] Who are the parties involved in the MOU? [/INST],  The parties involved in the MOU are the City of San José and the San José Police Officers’ Association. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the term of the promotional MOA between the City of San Jose and the San Jose Police Officers' Association? [/INST],  The term of the promotional MOA is from July 1, 2022, to June 30, 2025. </s>
<s>[INST] What is covered in Article 2 of the MOA? [/INST],  Article 2 of the MOA covers non-discrimination. </s>
<s>[INST] What is discussed in Article 6 of the MOA? [/INST],  Article 6 of the MOA discusses examination protests. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the effective date of the Promotions Memorandum of Agreement? [/INST],  The effective date of the Promotions Memorandum of Agreement is July 1, 2022. </s>

<s>[INST] Who are the parties involved in the Agreement? [/INST],  The parties involved in the Agreement are the City of San José, California (referred to as the 'City') and the San José Police Officers’ Association (referred to as the 'Employee Association' or 'Association'). </s>

<s>[INST] What is the non-discrimination policy in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  The non-discrimination policy in the City of San Jose is outlined in accordance with the City of San Jose Discrimination and Harassment policy, Section 1.1.1 of the City Policy Manual, and applicable State or Federal laws. It prohibits any form of discrimination or harassment in promotions against employees or organization members. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the eligibility requirements for the position of Police Sergeant in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  To qualify for an examination for Police Sergeant in the City of San Jose, an individual must have at least three (3) years of experience as a Police Officer for the City of San Jose. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the eligibility requirements for the position of Police Lieutenant in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  To qualify for an examination for Police Lieutenant in the City of San Jose, an individual must have at least two (2) years of experience as a Police Sergeant for the City of San Jose. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the eligibility requirements for the position of Police Captain in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  To qualify for an examination for Police Captain in the City of San Jose, an individual must have at least two (2) years of experience as a Police Lieutenant for the City of San Jose. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the eligibility requirements for the position of Deputy Chief of Police in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  To qualify for an examination for Deputy Chief of Police in the City of San Jose, an individual must currently hold the position of Police Captain and have at least two (2) years of experience as a Police Lieutenant for the City of San Jose. </s>

<s>[INST] Are there any minimum education requirements for certain positions in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  Yes, there may be minimum education requirements for certain positions in the City of San Jose. These requirements are included in the Classification Specifications. </s>
<s>[INST] When should public notice of upcoming tests be posted? [/INST],  Public notice of upcoming tests should be posted no later than sixty (60) days before the test date. </s>
<s>[INST] Can the applicant filing date or test date be extended? [/INST],  No, the applicant filing date or test date cannot be extended unless announced to all potential candidates. </s>

<s>[INST] How often does the City provide promotional counseling sessions for Police Officers? [/INST],  The City provides promotional counseling sessions at least once every calendar year for all Police Officers seeking advice on how best to prepare for their specific promotional testing process. Officers may participate on their own time. </s>

<s>[INST] How are test booklets and answer sheets identified for candidates taking an exam? [/INST],  Candidates taking an exam are given a test booklet and answer sheet identified with identical numbers. </s>

<s>[INST] What information should be listed under questions on exams regarding their source? [/INST],  All questions used in all written examinations should have their source listed in parenthesis under questions on exams. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the basis for the written examination questions for Sergeant and Lieutenant examinations? [/INST],  For Sergeant and Lieutenant examinations, questions on the written examination will be based upon the content of the departmental reading list if a written examination is given as part of that promotion process. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the weights for the Sergeant and Lieutenant examinations? [/INST],  The weights for the Sergeant and Lieutenant examinations are 40% for the written examination and 60% for the oral examination. The oral examination will include a writing exercise component, and the weight of the writing exercise component will vary from test to test depending on the job analysis conducted by the City’s consultant. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of using audio or video recording in the oral portion of an examination? [/INST],  The purpose of using audio or video recording in the oral portion of an examination is to ensure uniformity in the process. If any candidate is recorded, all candidates shall be similarly recorded. This helps maintain fairness and transparency in the evaluation process. </s>

<s>[INST] How many raters are allowed in the Sergeant and Lieutenant oral boards? [/INST],  The Sergeant boards can have a maximum of five (5) raters, while the Lieutenant boards can have a maximum of four (4) raters. </s>

<s>[INST] Who should be included as an observer in the Sergeant and Lieutenant oral boards? [/INST],  The Sergeant and Lieutenant oral boards should include a representative from the Office of Employee Relations or the Human Resources Department as an observer. </s>

<s>[INST] Who are the raters for promotional examinations for Sergeants and Lieutenants? [/INST],  The examinees elect two raters from Lieutenants and/or Captains in the San Jose Police Department, and the Director of Human Resources appoints two additional raters. </s>

<s>[INST] Can an observer designated by the Association be present during the pre-examination training and oral board for promotional examinations? [/INST],  Yes, an observer designated by the Association, who is not an employee of the City of San Jose, may be present during the pre-examination training of oral board members, the oral board itself, and discussion by oral board raters. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the observer during the examination process? [/INST],  The purpose of the observer during the examination process is to ensure fairness and integrity. They are responsible for monitoring the examination, ensuring that no disruptions occur, and protecting the confidentiality of the examination content and candidates' performance. At the conclusion of the examination, the observer will make a report and provide any recommendations to both the City and the Association. </s>

<s>[INST] How are Field Training Officer (FTO) incentive points added to the final score of the Sergeant and Lieutenant promotional examination? [/INST],  Field Training Officer (FTO) incentive points are added to the final score of the Sergeant and Lieutenant promotional examination. Officers receive one-half (0.5) point for each year of continuous service as an FTO, with a maximum of one and one-half points (1.5). These points are added to the officer's final score to provide recognition for their experience and contribution as an FTO. </s>

<s>[INST] During the protest period, how long are candidates allowed to view a keyed copy of the test booklet? [/INST],  Candidates are allowed an initial key review of two (2) hours by the Wednesday following a Saturday written test. Additional time will be provided as requested within the seven-day period during normal office hours. </s>

<s>[INST] Who will discuss protests with all interested candidates during the Protest Review Meeting? [/INST],  The Human Resources Director or designee will discuss protests with all interested candidates. </s>

<s>[INST] How long do candidates have to appeal in writing to the Civil Service Commission after receiving a determination letter from the Human Resources Director? [/INST],  Candidates have five (5) business days to appeal in writing to the Civil Service Commission. </s>

<s>[INST] How long after the final day an appeal may be filed will the meeting be held for the appellant? [/INST],  The meeting will be held within ten (10) calendar days of the final day an appeal may be filed. </s>

<s>[INST] How long are promotion lists maintained for? [/INST],  Promotion lists are maintained for two (2) years. At the discretion of the Director of Human Resources, the life of a list may be extended for an additional year. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the timeline for providing a new Sergeant and Lieutenant list? [/INST],  The Director of Human Resources shall make every reasonable effort to provide a new list within 90 days of the exhaustion or expiration of the Sergeant and/or Lieutenant list(s). </s>
<s>[INST] What is the 'Rule of 10' in promotions? [/INST],  The 'Rule of 10' applies in all promotions. </s>

<s>[INST] How are seniority points calculated for placement on Police promotional eligible lists? [/INST],  For the purposes of seniority, points added to test scores for placement on all Police promotional eligible lists are based solely on time in the qualifying grade, including any time earned in the qualifying grade prior to being rehired or reinstated following a break in service. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens if a person on a list is passed over for the second certification? [/INST],  If a person on a list is passed over for the second certification, they have the right to meet with the Chief or designee to discuss the specifics as to why they were passed over and to receive suggestions on how to enhance their chances for future promotion selection. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the probationary period for those promoted to the rank of Sergeant or above? [/INST],  The probationary period for those promoted to the rank of Sergeant or above is twelve (12) months. </s>

<s>[INST] How are disputes regarding the interpretation or application of the agreement resolved? [/INST],  Disputes regarding the interpretation or application of the agreement are resolved through the grievance procedures set forth in the Memorandum of Agreement between the City of San José and San José Police Officers’ Association. </s>
<s>[INST] Who signed the MOU between the City of San Jose and the San Jose Police Officers’ Association? [/INST],  Jennifer Maguire, City Manager and Sean Pritchard, President of SJPOA </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the agreement mentioned in the MOU? [/INST],  July 1, 2022 - June 30, 2025 </s>

<s>[INST] What is the duration of the Memorandum of Agreement between the City of San Jose and the International Association of Firefighters Local 230? [/INST],  The Memorandum of Agreement is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] Who are the parties involved in the Memorandum of Agreement? [/INST],  The parties involved in the Memorandum of Agreement are the City of San Jose and the International Association of Firefighters Local 230. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the term of the MOU between the City of San Jose and IAFF Local 230? [/INST],  The term of the MOU is from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>
<s>[INST] Which bargaining unit is involved in the MOU? [/INST],  The bargaining unit involved in the MOU is the International Association of Firefighters, Local 230. </s>

<s>[INST] What is Article 17 about? [/INST],  Article 17 in the MOU signed between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit is about Full Understanding, Modification, and Waiver. It outlines the provisions related to the complete understanding of the agreement, the process of modification, and the conditions for waiver. </s>

<s>[INST] What is Article 21 about? [/INST],  Article 21 in the MOU signed between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit is about Leaves of Absence. It covers the provisions related to different types of leaves that employees can take, such as sick leave, vacation leave, and other authorized leaves. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the IAFF MOA? [/INST],  The IAFF MOA is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>
<s>[INST] What is discussed in Article 29 of the MOU? [/INST],  Article 29 of the MOU covers miscellaneous topics such as pay checks, door locks, voter registration, and television training. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the subject of Article 30? [/INST],  Article 30 of the MOU deals with the maintenance of membership. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the topic of Article 31? [/INST],  Article 31 of the MOU pertains to bereavement leave. </s>
<s>[INST] What does Article 32 discuss? [/INST],  Article 32 of the MOU addresses authorized representatives. </s>

<s>[INST] What is Article 4 5 about? [/INST],  Article 4 5 in the MOU signed between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit is about nondiscrimination policies and practices within the city. </s>

<s>[INST] What is Article 4 6 about? [/INST],  Article 4 6 in the MOU signed between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit is about the donation of time for catastrophic illness situations. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the term of the Agreement between the City of San Jose and the International Association of Firefighters, Local 230? [/INST],  The term of the Agreement is from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the Memorandum of Agreement? [/INST],  The purpose of the Memorandum of Agreement is to establish the terms and conditions of the agreement between the City of San Jose and the International Association of Firefighters, Local 230. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the duration of the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens if the City establishes new classifications or transfers employees? [/INST],  If the City establishes new classifications or transfers employees in a way that materially reduces existing bargaining unit work, the parties agree to meet and confer. If no agreement is reached, they will pursue the remedies provided under the San José City Charter Section 1111. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the Memorandum of Agreement? [/INST],  The purpose of the Memorandum of Agreement is to define the meanings of words, phrases, and terms used in the agreement and to establish the terms and conditions of employment for the bargaining unit. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the wage increase for Fiscal Year 2018-2019 for employees in classifications assigned to IAFF, Local 230? [/INST],  For Fiscal Year 2018-2019, employees in classifications assigned to IAFF, Local 230 will receive a 1% ongoing non-pensionable compensation increase and a 3% general wage compensation increase. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the wage increase for Fiscal Year 2019-2020 for employees in classifications assigned to IAFF, Local 230? [/INST],  For Fiscal Year 2019-2020, employees in classifications assigned to IAFF, Local 230 will receive a 4.25% general wage increase. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the effective date of the 4.25% general wage increase for Fiscal Year 2020-2021? [/INST],  The effective date of the 4.25% general wage increase for Fiscal Year 2020-2021 is June 28, 2020. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the percentage of the general wage increase for Fiscal Year 2022-2023? [/INST],  The general wage increase for Fiscal Year 2022-2023 is approximately 3%. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the percentage of base pay that all persons represented by IAFF receive for anti-terrorism training? [/INST],  Approximately 2.0% of base pay. </s>
<s>[INST] Is the 2% Anti-Terrorism Training Pay pensionable? [/INST],  Yes, it is pensionable. </s>
<s>[INST] When will the 2% Anti-Terrorism Training Pay be rolled into base pay? [/INST],  Effective as soon as practicable following ratification by IAFF and City Council approval. </s>

<s>[INST] Is there any additional compensation for the completion of terrorism/anti-terrorism training? [/INST],  No, there is no additional compensation for the completion of terrorism/anti-terrorism training. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the requirements for an employee to be considered as 'Assigned Personnel' in Special Operations? [/INST],  The employee must have the relevant required training specified by EOPP and/or UOPP and must be designated by Assignment Order to HIT or USAR duties. </s>

<s>[INST] According to the MOU, can an employee be designated to more than one position at a time? [/INST],  No, an employee cannot be designated to more than one position at a time unless agreed to by both the City and the Union. </s>

<s>[INST] How is an employee's assignment determined for purposes of Articles 5.2.1.1 and 5.2.2.1? [/INST],  An employee's assignment for purposes of Articles 5.2.1.1 and 5.2.2.1 is determined solely by the most current Assignment Order in effect. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the eligibility criteria for receiving Special Operations Premium Pay? [/INST],  An employee serving in an administrative assignment cannot be considered Assigned Personnel for the purposes of Article 5.2 related to the Special Operations Premium Pay and is thus not eligible to receive Special Operations Premium Pay. Any ability, right, or eligibility for an employee to return to his/her Special Operations assignment after his/her administrative assignment ends does not render him/her eligible to receive the Special Operations Premium Pay during his/her administrative assignment. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the pay for Alternate Personnel assigned to HIT or USAR primary apparatus or task force Engine Company? [/INST],  All Alternate Personnel shall be paid $25.00 anytime they are assigned to a HIT or USAR primary apparatus (or cross-staffed apparatus) or task force Engine Company for four (4) or more hours during one 24 (twenty-four) hour shift. This includes overtime shifts and shift trades. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the shift trade pay for Assigned Personnel within their discipline? [/INST],  Assigned Personnel may have shift trades with Alternate Personnel within their discipline without premium pay implications. On such trades, there are no premium pay implications for Assigned Personnel. On such trades, Alternate Personnel shall be paid in accordance to the conditions of section 5.2.2.2. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the pay for employees who qualify for certification as an Emergency Medical Technician? [/INST],  Each employee who qualifies for certification as an Emergency Medical Technician shall be paid an amount equal to three percent (3.0%) of top step firefighter base biweekly pay for each pay period in which the employee is entitled to receive a salary, commencing with the first full pay period after the Fire Chief files with the Director of Finance a statement that the employee qualifies for such certification. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit represented by IAFF about? [/INST],  The MOU is about the recognition of the obligation for IAFF members who qualify for certification as an Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) by Santa Clara County. They will receive a flat dollar amount rolled into their base pay in recognition of their certification maintenance as an EMT. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the recognition of the obligation to maintain certification as an EMT result in? [/INST],  The recognition of the obligation to maintain certification as an EMT results in the rolled-in flat dollar amount being added to the base pay of IAFF members who qualify for certification by Santa Clara County as an EMT NA or EMT D Non Ambulance or Defibrillation. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the IAFF MOA between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The IAFF MOA is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the requirement for employees to maintain their EMT certification? [/INST],  Employees must maintain their EMT certification as a condition of continued employment. There is no additional compensation for the maintenance of their EMT certification. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the paramedic premium pay for front line paramedics? [/INST],  The paramedic premium pay for front line paramedics is an amount equal to twelve percent (12%) of top step firefighter base biweekly pay for each pay period in which the employee is entitled to receive a salary. </s>

<s>[INST] How is the paramedic premium pay included in a qualifying employee's new salary upon promotion? [/INST],  The paramedic premium pay (approximately 12%) is included in the employee's base salary when calculating their new salary upon promotion into a rank that does not receive paramedic premium pay. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the paramedic premium pay for support paramedics? [/INST],  The paramedic premium pay for support paramedics is an amount equal to eight percent (8.0%) of top step firefighter base biweekly pay for each pay period in which the employee is entitled to receive a salary. Employees assigned support paramedic duties on or after May 1, 2007, receive paramedic premium pay in an amount equal to five percent (5%) of top step firefighter base biweekly pay for each pay period in which the employee is entitled to receive a salary. </s>
<s>[INST] How many support paramedics can the City of San Jose assign? [/INST],  The City of San Jose can assign up to a maximum of one-hundred forty-seven (147) support paramedics. </s>

<s>[INST] When will a support paramedic receive Support Paramedic premium pay if they fail to complete the required number of patient contact reports in a calendar quarter? [/INST],  If a support paramedic fails to complete the required number of patient contact reports in any given calendar quarter, they will not receive Support Paramedic premium pay until the beginning of the first payroll pay period after they complete at least three (3) patient contact reports in a calendar quarter. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the IAFF MOA? [/INST],  The IAFF MOA is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the Support Paramedic position? [/INST],  The Support Paramedic position is assigned to each Company on each shift and is reserved for the most senior Support Paramedic who bids on a Company where no support paramedic exists. If no Support Paramedic bids for an open position, the least senior relief Support Paramedic will be assigned to that position. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Paramedic Pay for employees on administrative assignment? [/INST],  Employees on administrative assignment will continue to receive all other incentive and premium pays for which they are qualified. </s>

<s>[INST] How much is the Administrative Assignment Incentive Pay for Fire Prevention Inspectors? [/INST],  Employees in the Fire Prevention Inspector classification assigned to forty (40) hours per week positions shall receive Administrative Assignment Incentive Pay in the amount of $36.00 per pay period. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the criteria for receiving Bilingual Premium Pay? [/INST],  Each full-time employee certified Spanish-English or Vietnamese-English bilingual shall be compensated at the rate of 2.5% of top step Fire Fighter per pay period, if he or she is certified in English and another language by the Fire Chief and the Department of Human Resources, and if the employee's duties require the use of the designated language on a regular basis. </s>

<s>[INST] Who has the authority to require employees receiving bilingual pay to re-certify with the Department of Human Resources? [/INST],  The Fire Chief has the authority to require employees receiving bilingual pay to re-certify with the Department of Human Resources as necessary and reasonable. </s>

<s>[INST] What should the Fire Chief do if another Non-English language is required in the department? [/INST],  If the Fire Chief determines another Non-English language is required in the department, the Fire Chief may recommend that the language be eligible for the bilingual premium pay to the Director of Human Resources. The eligibility and certification of an additional Non-English language shall be in accordance with the above criteria. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The MOU is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens to an employee's premium pay while on disability leave? [/INST],  An employee on disability leave for two consecutive pay periods will not receive any premium pay, except for paramedic premium pay. The loss of premium pay starts after the second full consecutive pay period of reporting disability leave and continues until the employee returns to work. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the deductible for the HMO plan? [/INST],  The employee pays the difference between the total cost of the selected plan and the City’s contribution towards the lowest priced Non-Deductible HMO plan. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the co-pays for the available HMO plans? [/INST],  The co-pays for the available HMO plans are: a) Office Visit Co-pay of $25, b) Prescription Co-pay of $10 for generic and $25-$30 for brand name, c) Emergency Room Co-pay of $100, and d) Inpatient/Outpatient procedure Co-pay of $100. </s>

<s>[INST] Can an employee be simultaneously covered by the City-provided medical benefits and as a dependent of another City employee or retiree? [/INST],  No, an employee may not be simultaneously covered by the City-provided medical benefits as a City employee and as a dependent of another City employee or retiree. </s>

<s>[INST] What dental insurance coverage does the City provide for eligible full-time employees and their dependents? [/INST],  The City provides dental insurance coverage for eligible full-time employees and their dependents in accordance with one of the two available plans: an indemnity plan administered by Delta Dental, and a prepaid plan insured through Dental Benefit Providers. The dental program provided includes an option for either prepaid or indemnity coverage. The City will also cover any cost increases incurred during the term of the agreement for improvements in dental and orthodontia coverage resulting from discussions. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the lifetime maximum for orthodontic coverage for eligible full-time employees and their dependents? [/INST],  The lifetime maximum for orthodontic coverage for eligible full-time employees and their dependents is $2,000. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the maximum annual dental coverage for eligible full-time employees and their dependents? [/INST],  The maximum annual dental coverage for eligible full-time employees and their dependents is $1,500. </s>

<s>[INST] What percentage of the full premium cost does the City pay for selected dental coverage for eligible full-time employees and their dependents? [/INST],  The City pays ninety-five percent (95%) of the full premium cost for selected dental coverage for eligible full-time employees and their dependents. </s>
<s>[INST] Can retirees continue dental coverage? [/INST],  Yes, retirees can continue dental coverage under the terms defined in the San José Municipal Code Section 3.36, et seq. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens if a retiree who has selected prepaid dental coverage moves a significant distance away from a designated dental center? [/INST],  If a retiree who has selected prepaid dental coverage moves a significant distance away from a designated dental center, they may elect to be covered by other available options. </s>

<s>[INST] Can an employee be simultaneously covered by City-provided dental benefits as a City employee and as a dependent of another City employee or retiree? [/INST],  No, an employee cannot be simultaneously covered by City-provided dental benefits as a City employee and as a dependent of another City employee or retiree. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the amount of Life Insurance Coverage provided by the City for eligible full-time employees? [/INST],  The City provides Life Insurance Coverage in the amount of $10,000 for each eligible full-time employee who is a subscriber to life insurance benefits. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance program? [/INST],  The purpose of the payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance program is to allow employees who have double health and/or dental insurance coverage to drop the City's insurance and receive a payment-in-lieu. </s>

<s>[INST] Who is eligible for the payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance program? [/INST],  The payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance program is available to full-time employees who are not on a reduced work week or unpaid leave and have alternate group health and/or dental coverage. To qualify, an employee must provide proof of alternate group coverage to Human Resources. Alternate coverage must be acceptable by the City. </s>

<s>[INST] When can enrollment in the payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance program be done? [/INST],  Enrollment in the payment-in-lieu of health and/or dental insurance program can only be done during the first thirty (30) days of employment or during the annual open enrollment period. </s>

<s>[INST] Who is eligible to include domestic partners as dependents for benefits enrollment? [/INST],  IAFF members (active employees only) are eligible to include domestic partners as dependents for benefits enrollment. </s>

<s>[INST] Under what circumstances will payments for the in-lieu insurance program be discontinued? [/INST],  Payments for the in-lieu insurance program will be discontinued if an employee becomes ineligible for the program. This includes situations such as employment status changes from full to part time, employee is on an unpaid leave of absence, employee is on a reduced work week, or employee loses or does not have alternate insurance coverage. </s>

<s>[INST] Can an employee enroll in a City health and/or dental plan outside of the open enrollment period if they lose alternate coverage? [/INST],  Yes, if an employee loses alternate coverage, they may enroll in a City health and/or dental plan outside of the open enrollment period. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the eligibility criteria for enrolling in a City health insurance plan following loss of alternate coverage? [/INST],  To enroll in a City health insurance plan following loss of alternate coverage, the employee must pay all unpaid premiums (City and employee contributions) and refund any excess in-lieu-payments required to make the coverage effective on the date when alternate coverage ceased. Re-enrollment in the plan shall be in accordance with the carriers' enrollment procedures. </s>

<s>[INST] When does enrollment in a City dental insurance plan become effective following loss of alternate coverage? [/INST],  Enrollment in a City dental insurance plan following loss of alternate coverage will become effective the first of the month following payment of two (2) dental premiums through the City’s payroll process. Re-enrollment in the dental insurance plan shall not be retroactive. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Education Reimbursement Policy during the term of this Memorandum of Agreement? [/INST],  The Education Reimbursement Policy as provided in Section 4.3.1 of the City Policy Manual shall be continued during the term of this Memorandum of Agreement. In no event shall tuition received from this program plus reimbursement from other educational incentive programs exceed the total cost of tuition and books. The City will reimburse each employee one-hundred percent (100%) of expenses incurred, up to $1,000 per fiscal year, for registration, tuition, fees, and textbooks for college accredited courses which are either related to or beneficial for the employee’s current position; or related to or beneficial for a lateral transfer, promotion, or other career opportunity within the City service. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the maximum amount that can be used for non-college accredited courses and professional development in the MOU? [/INST],  The maximum amount that can be used for non-college accredited courses, continuing education units, adult education classes, workshops, membership dues in professional associations, professional licenses, and professional certificates is $600. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the types of professional development activities that can be covered under the MOU? [/INST],  The types of professional development activities that can be covered under the MOU include non-college accredited courses, continuing education units, adult education classes, workshops, membership dues in professional associations, professional licenses, and professional certificates that are related to or beneficial for the employee’s current position or related to or beneficial for a lateral transfer, promotion, or other career opportunity. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the IAFF MOA between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The IAFF MOA is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the education or tuition reimbursement program available to employees represented by IAFF, Local 230? [/INST],  The only education or tuition reimbursement program available to employees represented by IAFF, Local 230, is the one approved by the Fire Chief or designee. </s>

<s>[INST] Who will pay for the continuing education classes required for employees assigned to the City's paramedic program? [/INST],  The City will pay for the continuing education classes required for employees assigned to the City's paramedic program. </s>

<s>[INST] Will employees attending required continuing education classes during off-duty hours be compensated? [/INST],  Yes, employees attending required continuing education classes during off-duty hours will be compensated at the appropriate rate, subject to provisions outlined in Article 14, Hours of Work and Overtime. </s>

<s>[INST] What additional payment will employees receive if they have been awarded a degree by an accredited college or university? [/INST],  Employees who have been awarded an Associate of Arts degree, Associate of Science degree, a Bachelor of Arts degree, and/or a Bachelor of Science degree by an accredited college or university will receive an additional $35.00 for each biweekly pay period for which they are entitled to receive a salary. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the educational and professional incentive pay for firefighters effective June 28, 2020? [/INST],  The educational and professional incentive pay for firefighters effective June 28, 2020 is $35.00 per biweekly pay period, which is approximately 1.5% of top step Firefighter pay. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the annual Uniform Allowance for sworn personnel in certain classifications? [/INST],  The annual Uniform Allowance for sworn personnel in certain classifications is not to exceed $495.00. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of Article 9 in the MOU? [/INST],  The purpose of Article 9 in the MOU is to outline the conditions under which an employee may be required to perform the duties of a higher classification. </s>

<s>[INST] Under what circumstances can an employee be assigned to a higher classification? [/INST],  An employee can be assigned to a higher classification only when there is a specific assignment by the Department Head or a designated representative, and when there is a temporary absence of the regularly appointed employee in the higher classification position. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the IAFF MOA? [/INST],  The IAFF MOA is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] How are employees compensated when specifically assigned to duties of a higher classification? [/INST],  Employees specifically assigned to duties of a higher classification are compensated at a rate in the salary range of the higher class, which is at least one salary rate higher than their current class. However, this compensation is only paid if the employee has completed ten or more hours in a shift or ten or more hours in two consecutive shifts in the higher classification, and if the employee assigned to a forty-hour work week has completed at least half a day in the higher classification. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the call back pay for employees who are called back to work after their scheduled shift? [/INST],  Employees who are called back to work after their scheduled shift and have departed from their place of employment are credited with overtime for the time worked, or for three hours at the appropriate rate of compensation, whichever is greater. </s>

<s>[INST] How many times can an employee receive the three-hour minimum call back compensation per workday? [/INST],  An employee can receive the three-hour minimum call back compensation only once per workday. For subsequent call backs during the same day, the employee is credited with the time worked or for half an hour at the appropriate rate, whichever is greater. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the minimum time allowed for employees to arrive at the work site after receiving a call to report to duty? [/INST],  Employees are allowed one and one half (1.5) hours to arrive at the work site after receiving the call to report to duty. </s>

<s>[INST] How much compensation do employees receive for standby duty performed on a regularly assigned work day? [/INST],  Employees receive two (2) hours compensation at the appropriate rate for standby duty performed on a regularly assigned work day. </s>

<s>[INST] What compensation do employees receive for standby duty assigned on regularly scheduled days off? [/INST],  Employees receive three (3) hours compensation at the appropriate rate for standby duty assigned on regularly scheduled days off. </s>

<s>[INST] What compensation do employees receive when called back from standby duty? [/INST],  Employees are entitled to the compensation provided by Section 10.1 only, and not to any compensation pursuant to Section 10.2. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the policy regarding witness leave for City employees? [/INST],  City employees who are required to take time off duty to appear as a witness in any arbitration, administrative hearing, or court proceeding related to their employment with the City shall receive their regular salary during the time of service as a witness, less any witness fees received thereafter. </s>

<s>[INST] Do employees receive overtime when called to testify in an arbitration, administrative hearing, or court proceeding related to their employment? [/INST],  Yes, employees called from off-duty status to testify in such proceedings under subpoena sought by the City or other directive of the City on any subject connected with their employment shall be credited with overtime. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the provision for overtime credit for employees in arbitration, administrative hearings, or court? [/INST],  Employees shall be credited with overtime for the time spent in arbitration, administrative hearings, or court, for either the actual time spent or three hours, whichever is greater, less any witness fees received. </s>

<s>[INST] What should an employee do upon receiving a subpoena? [/INST],  An employee should immediately inform their Department Head or supervisor of the subpoena and the time they are required to appear in court. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the duration of the MOU between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The MOU is valid from July 1, 2018, to June 30, 2023. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the compensation for full-time employees who serve as jurors? [/INST],  Full-time employees who serve as jurors will receive their regular base compensation, excluding jury fees received and mileage. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the MOU signed between the City of San Jose and the bargaining unit? [/INST],  The purpose of the MOU is to establish the terms and conditions of employment for the bargaining unit in the City of San Jose. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens if an employee assigned to a 24-hour shift serves on a jury on their assigned work day? [/INST],  If an employee assigned to a 24-hour shift serves on a jury on their assigned work day, they are required to return to their assigned station upon completion of the jury service. If they are required to report for jury service on the following day, they will be released from their assigned work shift at 9:00 p.m. and this time off will be considered time worked. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the mileage reimbursement rate for employees who use their private automobile for work in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  Employees who are authorized to use their private automobile for work in the City of San Jose are entitled to receive and be paid a mileage reimbursement rate consistent with the City's rate. </s>
<s>[INST] Can employees repair their private vehicles while on duty? [/INST],  No, employees are not allowed to repair their private vehicles while on duty. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the maximum reimbursement for deductible provided by the insurance for employees who suffer loss to their private vehicle while on duty? [/INST],  Employees who suffer any loss to their private vehicle while being operated while on duty and covered by their collision insurance shall be reimbursed for any deductible provided by the insurance, up to a maximum of $1,000 per loss. </s>

<s>[INST] What work period has the City of San Jose established for overtime calculations? [/INST],  The City of San Jose has established a twenty-eight (28) day work period for overtime calculations. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the normal work schedule in terms of hours per week? [/INST],  The normal work schedule in the City of San Jose is forty (40) hours per week. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the duration of the work week for employees assigned to twenty-four hour shifts? [/INST],  Employees assigned to work twenty-four hour shifts are required to work at least an average of fifty-six hours per week. </s>

<s>[INST] How many hours per biweekly pay period are employees not assigned to work twenty-four hour shifts required to work? [/INST],  Employees not assigned to work twenty-four hour shifts are required to work an average of eighty hours per biweekly pay period. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the work week requirement for employees in the City of San Jose? [/INST],  The work week requirement for employees in the City of San Jose is not specified in the provided content. </s>
<s>[INST] How should employees report their working hours? [/INST],  Employees should report their working hours in fifteen (15) minute increments. </s>
